From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2023 American filmThe Re-Education of Molly SingerDirected byAndy PalmerWritten byTodd M. FriedmanKevin HaskinProduced byWarner DavisTodd M. FriedmanStarringBritt RobertsonMusic by
Jina Hyojin An
Shirley Song
ProductioncompaniesWarner Davis CompanyHemlock Circle ProductionsDistributed byLionsgateRelease date
September 29, 2023 (2023-09-29)
Running time120 minutesCountryUnited StatesLanguageEnglish
The Re-Education of Molly Singer is a 2023 American comedy film written by Todd M. Friedman and Kevin Haskin, directed by Andy Palmer and starring Britt Robertson.[1][2]


Plot[edit]
This article needs a plot summary. Please add one in your own words. (October 2023) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Cast[edit]
Britt Robertson as Molly Singer
Ty Simpkins as Elliot
Jaime Pressly as Brenda
Nico Santos as Paulie
Cierra Ramirez as Lindsay
Release[edit]
The film was released in theaters and on VOD on September 29, 2023.[3]

Reception[edit]
The film has a 25% rating on Rotten Tomatoes based on 16 reviews.[4]  Bobby LePire of Film Threat rated the film an 8 out of 10.[1]  Kate Erbland of IndieWire graded the film a C−.[3]

References[edit]


^ a b LePire, Bobby (October 4, 2023). "The Re-Education of Molly Singer". Film Threat. Retrieved October 12, 2023.

^ D'Alessandro, Anthony; Cordero, Rosy (July 30, 2021). "'The Re-Education Of Molly Singer': Britt Robertson, Nico Santos, Holland Roden & More Board Indie Feature". Deadline Hollywood. Retrieved October 12, 2023.

^ a b Erbland, Kate (September 27, 2023). "'The Re-Education of Molly Singer' Review: The 'Never Been Kissed' Formula Gets Flipped — to Dismal Results". IndieWire. Retrieved October 12, 2023.

^ "The Re-Education of Molly Singer". Rotten Tomatoes. Retrieved October 12, 2023.
